document.docAuthor: Gan, Jiahui, Irfan, Muhammad, Peng, Xianjin, Ran, Siyu & Zhan, Ying
document.docTitle: Mimetus yinae Gan & Irfan & Peng & Ran & Zhan 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of the genus Mimetus Hentz, 1832 (Araneae: Mimetidae) from Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau of China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of the genus Mimetus Hentz, 1832 (Araneae: Mimetidae) from Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau of China

figureCitation.captionText-0: Fig. 5. Mimetus yinae sp. nov. A–B, E. Holotype, ♂ (GZ-MIM-2015-005). C–D. Paratype, ♀ (GZ- MIM-2017-001). A. Palp, prolateral view. B. Palp, retrolateral view. C. Epigyne, ventral view. D. Vulva, dorsal view. E. Left chelicerae, ventral view. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: Fig. 6. Mimetus yinae sp. nov. A, C–E. Holotype, ♂ (GZ-MIM-2015-005). B, F–G. Paratype, ♀ (GZ- MIM-2017-001). A–B. Habitus, dorsal view. C. Palp, prolateral view. D. Palp, retrolateral view. E. Left chelicerae, ventral view. F. Epigyne, ventral view. G. Vulva, dorsal view. Scale bars: A–B = 1.0 mm; C–G = 0.1 mm
figureCitation.captionText-2: Fig. 7. Distribution records of Mimetus bucerus sp. nov. (▲), M. lingbaoshanensis sp. nov. (●) and M. yinae sp. nov. (■).

subSubSection.paragraph:
The new species resembles
M. echinatus Wang, 1990
, especially in the cymbial apex of male palp with several macrosetae and distal part of paracymbium with a subtriangular outgrowth ( Wang 1990 : figs 5A–B, 6C–D;
Zeng et al . 2016
: figs 1B–C, 2A–B), but can be distinguished from the latter by 1) vexillum of male palp columnar in retrolateral view ( Figs 5B , 6D ) versus sheet-like in
M. echinatus
(
Zeng et al . 2016
: figs 1B–C, 2A–B); 2) the structure of the distal division of bulb different; 3) scape of epigyne bell-shaped in ventral view ( Figs 5C , 6F ) versus trapezoid in
M. echinatus
(
Zeng et al . 2016
: figs 1B–C, 2A–B); 4) length of basal plate about 2.5 times of its width in ventral view ( Figs 5C , 6F ) versus about 4 times in
M. echinatus
(
Zeng et al . 2016
: figs 1B–C, 2A–B).
The specific name is patronym in honour of prof. Changming Yin, one of the most famous Chinese arachnologists.

materialsCitation.collectorName: Cheng Wang & Mingyong Liao & Tian-jun Liu & Gao-tao Liu & Xing Kuang & Peng Luo

subSubSection.paragraph:
CHINA • 2 ♀♀ ; same data as for holotype; GZ-MIM-2015-006 , GZ-MIM-2015-007
•
1 ♀ , Shibing County , Maxi Township , Bajiaoping Village ; 27°18′8″ N , 108°5′55″ E ;
990 m
;
13 Jul. 2017
; Xiao-qi Mi , Cheng Wang , Feng-e Li , Gui-jie Tian and Hong Liu leg.; GZ-MIM-2017-001
•
2 ♀♀ ; Shiqian County , Ganxi Township , Fuyan Village ; 27°21′39″ N , 108°1′59″ E ;
708.9 m
;
16 Jul. 2017
; Xiao-qi Mi , Cheng Wang , Feng-e Li , Gui-jie Tian and Hong Liu leg.; GZ-MIM-2017-002, GZ-MIM-2017-003
.
Male ( holotype )
MEASUREMENTS. Total length. 4.68.
CLYPEUS. 0.25 high.
EYE. Sizes and interdistances:AME 0.21, ALE 0.15, PME 0.13, PLE 0.12, AME–AME 0.05, ALE–AME 0.07, PME–PME 0.11, PME–PLE 0.22. MOA anterior width 1.08, posterior width 1.05, length 0.38.
CHELICERAE ( Figs 5E , 6E ). red-brown, with 10 promarginal peg setae and 2 retromarginal teeth.
ENDITES. Light yellow, longer than wide.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 6.
Mimetus yinae
sp. nov. A , C–E . Holotype, ♂ (GZ-MIM-2015-005). B , F–G . Paratype, ♀ (GZ- MIM-2017-001). A–B . Habitus, dorsal view. C . Palp, prolateral view. D . Palp, retrolateral view. E . Left chelicerae, ventral view. F . Epigyne, ventral view. G . Vulva, dorsal view. Scale bars: A–B = 1.0 mm; C–G = 0.1 mm

subSubSection.paragraph: LABIUM. Light yellow, longer than wide.
STERNUM. Pear-shaped, glabrous, yellow, with few macrosetae on margin.
PALP ( Figs 5 A–B, 6C–D).
CYMBIUM. Slightly domed, with a columnar vexillum, about 4 times longer than wide, and several macrosetae at the apex ( Figs 5B , 6D ).
PARACYMBIUM. Elongate, strongly sclerotized, slightly curved towards the bulb, with a subtriangular outgrowth distally ( Figs 5B , 6D ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 7. Distribution records of
Mimetus bucerus
sp. nov. (▲),
M. lingbaoshanensis
sp. nov. (●) and
M. yinae
sp. nov. (■).

subSubSection.paragraph: SUBTEGULUM. Semicircular; the distal division of bulb rolls up as sulciform to protect embolus ( Figs 5 A– B, 6C–D).
EMBOLUS. Slender, and terminal part covered by the distal division of bulb in prolateral view ( Figs 5A , 6C ).
Female ( paratype )
MEASUREMENTS. Total length 5.33.
CLYPEUS. 0.21 high.
EYE. Sizes and interdistances: AER 0.20, ALE 0.23, PME 0.13, PLE 0.15, AME–AME 0.04, AME–ALE 0.11, PME–PME 0.10, PME–PLE 0.20. MOA anterior width 1.08, posterior width 1.12, length 0.47.
CHELICERAE. Endites and labium colouration as in male. Chelicerae with 8 promarginal peg setae and 2 retromarginal teeth.

EPIGYNE ( Figs 5 C–D, 6F–G). Slightly longer than wide, basal plate big, concave and about 3 times longer than its width ( Figs 5C , 6F ). Scape bell-shaped, the terminal overlap the posterior margin of basal plate ( Figs 5C , 6F ). Copulatory openings cambered, posterior-bilaterally ( Figs 5C , 6F ). Spermathecae oval, touches each other medially ( Figs 5D , 6G ).
China ( Guizhou , Fig. 7 ).
